content:
1, 2014
												The most beautifully immersive game I've ever played. Running around licking cars is everybody's dream. And this game lets you live it. This game is life itself personified and moreso. I had no life until I had a Goat Simulator.This game is truly limitless, if not for its authentic goat noises to the ability to run off the map without spazzing out everywhere and teleporting to a random place with a glitched neck. It has a little bit that caters for everyone.My favourite part of Goat Simulator is I can finally achieve my lifelong goal of becoming a goat. I can feel the light on my furry nostrils as my devil horns rule over my sacrifices. I can become the tall goat of the Savannah, never before discovered or named quite so fondly. Although it is not quite the same as putting my hooves on daily and experiencing first hand my goatish complexion, Goat Simulator establishes the balance between reality and goats. Indicating there truly is a goat within us all. For the human race is born goats.                                     This game has made me a better person.                                                                  Amen.

content:
2, 2014
												Pac-Man Championship Edition seemed like the perfect Xbox Live Arcade game when it arrived back in 2007 -- but an even better version is now available on PlayStation Network. Somehow, gaming's oldest mascot is delivering one of the most exciting games of the year. More mazes, more modes, more ghosts...lots more ghosts, actually. This "deluxe" version takes everything that made Championship Edition great and adds a bunch of cool new stuff. It's like taking a great white shark and adding laser beam eyes and saw blades that shoot out of its mouth.Pac-Man Championship Edition DX is all about gunning for a high score. Games are timed, so you need to eat as many pellets, fruits, and ghosts as possible before the clock stops. You don't die as often as you did in the original Pac-Man, you earn plenty of extra lives, and you have many bombs at your disposal to get out of tight spots. (Yes, Pac-Man can now trigger bombs that send all of the ghosts back to their hideout.) Without much fear of death, you can focus on the one thing that matters: representing on the online score boards.Pac-Man now has many more ghosts to contend with. Like, a hundred more. You'll see the spirits sleeping around a maze, and as Pac-Man whizzes by they'll wake up and give chase. Hold off on eating a Power Pellet long enough and you may find dozens of ghosts trailing behind you in a long conga line. Finally grabbing that Power Pellet and devouring a hundred ghosts in a row is one of the most satisfying things I've done in a game this year. This is also a key technique in getting those high scores.While the first Championship Edition was super fun, there were only a couple of mazes and modes. DX has nine mazes, most of which are new creations that offer a lot of variety. For example, Spiral has several coils that are easy to get trapped in. Dungeon, on the other hand, has long, cramped corridors. Each maze also has many game options such as Score Attack, Time Trials, and Ghost Combos (see how many ghosts you can eat with one Power Pellet). When you first dive into Championship Edition DX, only the standard Championship II course is unlocked, but each round you play usually unlocks a new maze or mode.Like I said, it's all about the high score, and Championship Edition DX provides many friendly ways to see how you rank against the competition. You can comb through the leaderboards for extensive data on all the many maps and modes, but there are other really nice touches: your current ranking is displayed right on the title screen, the Course Select screen, and again within the menu for each maze.Pac-Man Championship Edition DX also looks and sounds great. You can select from a variety of maze skins and character designs for each game, running from the 3D Pac-Mania characters to pixilated retro sprites. The lively electronic soundtrack builds in intensity as the game timer ticks down and always gets me leaning forward in my chair.THE VERDICTPac-Man Championship Edition DX boasts simple, addictive gameplay that will have you competing for high scores on the score boards for months. Everything that made the first game a hit is still here, accompanied by a bunch of new mazes, modes, and ghosts -- all for $10. It's hard to imagine a more perfect PlayStation Network game. This is a master class in game design: you will understand it instantly, enjoy it instantly, and want to play again and again.10/10 like skyrim but with guns

content:
9, 2014
												This game is unique. Truly, truly unique. In an age where most video games do take themselves seriously (as is understandable in a world that still somehow downplays video gaming as a valid, competitive piece of the entertainment industry as a whole), it is absolutely refreshing to see a game like this come out that's not trying to be a masterpiece, or tell an in-depth story. Goat Simulator is ridiculous, colorful, somewhat pointless, hilarious, and a ton of fun.I had an argument with my best friend, who said he thought it was ridiculous this game was getting so much attention because the Meta-Critic score left much to be desired. I think he missed the whole point.Goat Simulator has glitches. The world exists for no reason other than for you to rampage through it as a goat. The people who walk through this world will literally run into things such as street posts and fall down in a pile of tangled limbs. I saw one guy walk up over a concrete guardrail and into a river, where he proceeded to float down the river without trying to swim to safety. The physics don't make sense in this game and are barely realistic. The game has a ton of technical flaws. You get stuck. You can fall through floors and fly through walls. And yes, the frame rate drops frequently, particularly when I try to jetpack my goat into space, just as I burst through the earth's atmosphere.THAT'S the point. That throughout all of its flaws, it is still a hilarious ride through a ridiculous premise of a game that is not meant to win any awards, it is meant to be FUN. It is meant to be hilarious. It is meant to be there for you when you're having a bad day and just want to launch a game for a few minutes to feel better. To be honest, half of the time glitches happen, they're hilarious. They add to the game and are not a detriment at all. Even the frame rate drops don't bother me, because...I mean, come on. My goat is going to space with a freaking jetpack. The frame rate drop feels NECESSARY with something that epic. I recommend this game to pretty much everyone. It's cheap as it is, and on sale it's a steal. At the very least, you'll have a lot of fun and laughs for a few hours in a game so ridiculous it's a miracle it exists. This is a game that exists solely for fun and entertainment value, and that is what it succeeds at.

												Since their inception, computer and video games have both fascinated and caused great fear in the politicians, educators, academics, and the public at large. In the United States, this fear and fascination goes back to the early 1980s, when Ronald Reagan extolled the virtues of games to create a generation of highly skilled cold war warriors, The United States Army's Task Force XXI program (TF-XXI), also known as the Next-Generation Integrated Infantry Fighting System, was a series of trial exercises and initiatives conducted by the U.S. Army, in the interest of modernization. The goal was to test unique concepts, tactics, and technologies on the modern-day battlefield. The exercises involved virtual reality training for selected soldiers during the late 1990s, but it is said to have been under research and development since the 1980s. Some of the technology that was tested includes software-defined radios, digital transmitters installed on all their weapons, appliqué computers carried by each soldier (to minimize casualties and maximize combat effectiveness by sharing data), ground surveillance radar, satellite radio e-mail systems, and unmanned combat aerial vehicles. Members of this division also had some degree of access to top secret development projects in the military.The impact of digital games on learning and behavior, as conceptualized through researchers in the military and indeed the learning sciences communities is an important, but frequently overlooked area of games studies. My hope is that in the upcoming months, discussions around gaming and cognition will draw upon research in the learning sciences and possible military applications of videogames such as Goat Simulator.

												When I first laid eyes on this game, it was April 1st 2014 and I was highly amused by Steam's version of an April Fool's joke; because, a goat simulator, come on! However, it did puzzle me how much work they had put into the delightful screencaps, and it almost seemed real and ready to buy. (Needless to say; I was even more puzzled when the game remained in the store even after April 1st.)Then, some months later, a friend recommended it to me, and when it was on sale, I thought; okay, why not?Now I should mention that I am a busy student and have my library filled with unfinished games because I have barely time to play. And at the time when I bought Goat Simulator, I hadn't played anything for more than an hour in a while.I bought Goat Simulator, with the MMO Simulator already implemented, and whoa, in the first week I managed to play 26 hours in total; easily surpassing my general playtime over the past months. I was hooked. And I remain hooked. 10/10

content:
5, 2014
												Goat simulator is a fun idea, and it has alot of wacky moments and it is a joy to play.  It honestly is.But I cannot give it a positive review at the time of writing.  There are only developer maps (One I cannot even play.)  It kinda boils down to... bugs are a feature.   I don't mind bugs in games, some of them have bugs that turned out for the better, some games have bugs that break the game.  Some of Goat simulators bugs are kinda neat, but the game almost bricked my computer, causing blue screens, lockups, and a brown screen upon rebooting once.The game is fun, it is, but the fun is thin, it runs out, once you do...everything thats pretty much it, just rense repeate, I think the developers are banking on fan made content to carry the lifespan on, but no offence to people who create great content, I prefer what the devloper makes, so maybe the fan made stuff saves it.  I wouldn't know.I would wait on buying the game, if what is shown on youtube looks appealing just watch that a few more times.  I strongly urdge the developers to review their policy on bugs with the game, I do not have a top end PC, and that may be why this game almost bricked it.  I'll write a more positive review when some of the issues have been addressed, bugs have been fixed and probably when it is out of early access.I really want to like this game.

content:
5, 2014
												"Piece of art"Goat Simulator is the new and promising game by Swedish game developer Coffee Stain Studios.In the game you get to play as a goat and all you have to do is to wreck things and hurt people.Many people think that Goat Simulator is "funny" or even "stupid", but what they don't understand is the fact, that the game is criticism of our modern society in asophisticated way: The people behind Coffee Stain Studios want to say that a goat simply could not fit into our society, it would just destroy everything without knowingwhat it does. You get the feeling that you cannot be a normal human being. You are being reminded by this depressing fact in every possible way:  - You see robots - When you want to attend a family dinner, you cannot do anything but destroy it. - When playing the popular video game "Flappy Bird" you, and only you, are a goat in the game.Other people in the city will not react to your cries for help, they will only run away from you. You are searching for attention but everyone will ignore you.Another sad fact is that you will encounter one scene in the game where people actually pay attention to you, but they just want to see you fight against other goats.The atmosphere of the game is very depressing. Seeing how the town is slowly being destroyed by protesters, that don't want "♥♥♥♥♥ shaped food" nearly made me shed a tear.This criticism makes the game something speacial, I would even say it will get the "GO(A)TY 2014" award.Coffee Stain studios have done a really good job by implementing a workshop feature, that allows players to create other maps, goats and other things.=> I highly recommend this game because of its' unique experience. However it is quite expensive and not really worth 10€.5€ would be more matching with the cost-benefit ratio.

content:
, 2014
												As an avid Goat enthusiast/fetishist, I bought 'Goat "Simulator"' during the recent steam sale, and I must reluctantly say, it was not worth the purchase. The game prides itself on being a 'Simulator', yet the realistic experience of playing a goat that was advertised is not delivered upon. For example- 1) Goat's tounges are NOT adhesive, and they do not have the strength to pull along cars or people, as this game suggests. 2) There is no Goat devil or angel - goats do not have a religion. 3) The goat in this game can survive falls from extreme heights, explosions, being hit by cars, and being sucked into fans. Goats in real life are NOT immortal. 4) Goats cannot perform front OR backflips, nor can they 'manual' on their front paws. 5) In reality, Goats are NOT able to ride on Bikes or skateboards. Goats have a poor sense of balance, due to a natural inner-ear problem evident in their species  - this is perhaps the one thing this game portrays accurately. Overall, this game was extremely dissapointing. I expected another game for me to spend hours in, simulating my dream of being a goat and mating with female goats, or milking myself, yet in the end I found this game lacking of everything that I expected.

content:
10, 2014
												This game sucks.Yes yes, it's an april fools joke, I understand, I have some humour. But ten euros for this disaster is just overpriced and it's one of the top selling games already for a week just because youtubers play it.So, there are multiple factors that make this game an abomination.The bugs, this game is one of the buggiest games I've ever seen, when you start to play it it is so funny HAHA THAT GOAT DOES FUNNY HAHA, but after a half hour all the jokes in this game become very repetitive and plain annoying. You can't walk without tripping over anything and then you have to wait until your goat stands up again, and three seconds later he's on the ground again. Also, when you're trying to do something it happens sometimes that you fly all over to the other side of the map because of a random programmed bug. And other situations are that you're trying to get on a roof for a trophy for the achievements, but you keep falling through the roof and then you have to climb up all your way back. And don't get me started on the bug that some 3d models like cars or trampolines don't appear until you're close to them.The controls, the controls are so annoying, your goat goes most of the time for no reason in "muscles off" mode, and sometimes it takes time to undo that, guess why, because the controls aren't responding. The game is set for a QWERTY keyboard, mine is AZERTY, in almost all games you can edit the controls, and in all of those they stay saved, but of course, in this one, the controls don't save, you have to redo the controls all the time again and again and it gets annoying quick, and because that you get stuck a lot, you have to reset the game again and again and that obviously correlates with resetting the controls. There are also some control bugs, like when you start a new game the controls are not responding, etc.... And the worst thing is the acceleration of your goat. Since you fall so much, you have to accelerate again, and it goes from very slow to fast that you can't control your goat, and when you stop your goat while running he might fall over.The achievements, most are very easy to get, it's fun getting a lot of achievements quick and seeing funny things, but then there are the unfair ones. And I mean unfair, not challenging. For example, the achievements of Payday 2 are insanely hard, but fair, the achievements of Angry Video Game Nerd adventures are hard, it's a hard platformer, but still, fair. But the achievements are this just ♥♥♥♥ you off so much. Let's take the all trophies one, some trophies are very easy to get, but others are on impossible locations with such big bugs that they're impossible to get that it takes you so many tries. Like the one under the fan, there is a spinning fan on a hard to reach location, and behind that fan theres a trophy, and the fan spins fast, and if you touch it you get rocketed to the other side of the map, that means you have to walk so much and fall over a lot again, reach that hard to reach location, and then try again. And since the controls are so annoying it's almost impossible to go over the fan, it took me so long and it was so annoying, but that's only one of the multiple hard to reach and unfair trophies. The jump on the five trampolines in one jump trophy is so annoying too because you can't see the trampolines until you are close to them because of bugs. So you have to search all the map for trampolines and perfectly remember their placement and then jump the very buggy jump controls which takes ages. And then there's the worst... the horrible... flappy goat achievement.... It's like flappy bird, but on a very small screen, full of bugs and much faster. So you go in a building and there's a tv there and on it flappy goat. The screen of that tv is small so you have to look very good, and it goes fast and you flap high. Also, the worst about it is the horrible collision, your goat touches the pipes even when it's not touching it, you really have to be far away from the pipes to not touch them, this took me a hour of pure frustration to do.Well, that's about it, this game is overrated, a disaster, overpriced and annoying. 1/10 just because it made me laugh in the first half hour

												Goat Simulator is a joke of a game. It’s small, deliberately unpolished and buggy, and its design is simple. So it’s a good thing it’s a really funny joke, full of great physics-powered slapstick humor, and unexpected surprises in every corner of its seemingly peaceful small-town map. There’s not much actual gameplay here beyond breaking things for points, but shooting for a high score is probably the least entertaining thing about Goat Simulator. It’s mostly about exploring the fun house and discovering the hilarious surprises at your own pace.

content:
4, 2014
												Moment of real talk here. Is it ten US dollars good? In terms of content volume, stability, polish, structure, and consistency, on those very descriptors alone, no.However, this game basically tells us here in 2014 that, in the end, we just want to have fun. This game is fun. For how long it's fun is up to you. Even so, there is a definite primal reaction this game elicits that will tell all but the most jaded, or those who seriously crave structure, that yes, you are having fun. You are enjoying this nonsense. It wants nothing more than for you to just go forth and have fun discovering weird things and wreak havoc in ways where you may not always be in precise control, but you are probably enjoying it just for what silliness goes on by your hand (or tongue).It's a novelty, but it is also a powerful statement for the curiosity it is. There's a reason people wanted to play this, and it wasn't brand name, or celebrity voice actors, or any sort of technological prowess to show off the day's advanced hardware. It was because it looked fun, and I believe their expectations - and mine - have been met. If you just want to press WASD and be the rudest tourist visiting human society possible in the process, you will have fun.That should be the quality we take into account most of all with any of these games.

												I pledge allegiance to the goat Of the United States of GoatmericaAnd to the Baaa-public for which it stands One nation under goats, IndivisibleWith liberty and justice for goats Okay, that's enough jokes involving goats and 'Murica. This game is esentially a physics-based Three Stooges game, only this time Moe, Larry, and Curly are gone and in their place is a humble goat that defies the laws of physics and gets into absurdist slapstick mayhem complete with oddball gags and easter eggs. It's dumb, crazy fun for those that want a good set of laughs.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
2, 2014
												I was one of the ones who begged them from the very beginning to release this as a full game. What they have delivered here is better than I had hoped for. A good amount of PC options, key rebinding (although not for controllers yet), it looks pretty nice, and while it doesn't run amazingly, it runs well enough.And as far as content goes, its more than what I was expecting (a simple tech demo), but it's not really equivalent to a full game. However, with that said, the inclusion of Workshop support opens up so many amazing possibilities. I just hope the community gets behind it to make some really creative and interesting content. While mutators and skins do add to the experience, what it really comes down to for longevity is maps to play on. Parkour Challenges, Skate Parks, Interesting Environments to explore, etc etc. I believe the devs did say that they actually called the game just "Goat Simulator" instead of adding 2014, to show that it's going to be a single game that is just expanded with content from both themselves and users on the workshop.While it is mostly lacking in content, I would say that what is provided here, is incredibly fun. I just replayed Dishonored recently for a no detection/kill run, and I was reminded how much I absolutely love that game. But it's a different type of enjoyment. Intense concentration, timing, and the satisfaction of success. Goat Simulator, put a huge smile on my face for hours, and honestly a game hasn't done that for a while. I was a tad frustrated at a specific challenge or two, but other then that it was all laughs.I wouldn't say it's worth $10, simply because there are better games with far more content for less. Its sort of unfair comparing it to games that go on sale, but all that really means is that you should wait till a sale or bundle to pick it up. I was able to pickup the game for ~ -$3 (yes negative) after cards and rewards, and at that price I am incredibly satisfied.TL;DR Incredibly enjoyable, nice graphics and PC settings. Lacking in content, but the workshop and continued developer support could prove to make up for that. Not really worth $10 so wait for a sale or bundle.UPDATE:They added not only a second whole map with even more content, area, and secrets to find, but they also added another one that lets you play in the style of an MMO, poking fun at various tropes. The MMO map/mode is even larger than the first two, and it mixes it up quite a bit with skills, an inventory system (that can be used in other modes as well, to carry around objects with you rather than dragging them one at a time), as well as quite a few goofy quests with more varied mechanics and objectives. They have definitely delivered here with more completely free content, and users have done the same through the workshop. I'm not sure how long they will continue to add more content, but I'd say it's completely worth picking up at the usual sale prices if you have a suited sense of humor, or enjoy old skateboarding games.

												Oh, my head hurts.  So much.  And I've only been playing for TEN MINUTES... Someone made a "funny" game, and the amazing bit is...it's actually FUNNY!  Quite an accomplishment indeed.  Truly some of the most idiotic feats of physics I have ever witnessed/executed, and it's STILL a more convincing "physics simulator" than Bad Rats!!     Oh, and you can consider the GTA games officially obsolete.  If you feel like a ten minute sociopathic "spree"/♥♥♥♥-around, Goat Simulator should be your game of choice.  Who needs to run down pedestrians in sports cars when you can head-butt cars and make them EXPLODE?!     Think I'll save this one for those times when I simply cannot endure day-to-day life/humanity any longer, and need myself a good laugh/mini-aneurism.  Truly one of the greatest "gimmick" games in the history of gaming. Verdict: 8.5/10 (c'mon...it doesn't deserve more than THAT.  It's still ♥♥♥♥in' stoopid).

content:
6, 2014
												For years my goat enthusiast friends and I have been searching for a game that fully takes advantage of the many paradigms that goats have to offer. Coffee Stain Studios had a chance to capture a niche market looking for the ultimate in goat simulation software. I had considered investing thousands in computer peripherals to enhance my simulation experience, including buying a 640 by 480 monitor to better simulate goat vision, goat food trays for my desk as well as a conversion of my gaming room into a barn.  There was a palpable desire for this game amongst us in the goat enthusiast community for many years, and this game promised to deliver with realistic physics and visuals. For the past few months since I have heard about this game, I have begun eating nothing but dried grass and water and sat next to my calendar and my computer waiting for the game to be released. This game consumed me that the only thing I could say was “I love goats” in a vacant voice. I have not moved for 3 weeks now, my room smells horrible. My wife and kids have left me, but I’m not really sure because they didn’t matter now that Goat Simulator was on the horizon. Soon I could be the goat. Soon I would be ready to receive. My body most definitely was ready.However, much to my dismay, Coffee Stain Studios merely mocked us in the goat enthusiast community. This game was an utter disappointment. I want my goat simulators designed by goat experts, who have had years in the field. Clearly these people have never met goats. I have been a connoisseur in goats for over 30 years, and this game is nothing more than contrived misinformation by governments worldwide against the goat cause. There seems to be a vendetta against goats in this society, these ‘goatists’ such as the ones at Coffee Stain Studios have  insulted the entire goat race and they should apologise. I demand a refund. This goat persecution should not be tolerated. I have reached out to many news agencies to hear my plight, and I am hoping Anita Sarkeesian will address this issue in the next goatist frequency video.Pros:-	The New Lick Feature is much appreciated – it brought many things to the gameplay I did not expect possible with our current technology. I was able to realistically simulate goat.Cons:-	I was hoping for a 24/7 live updated, real time world with weather affects and PhysX GoatTM, with live feed satellite rendering of the earth’s surface so I could realistically move my goats between all the world’s major goat farming areas and enter my goat into beauty contests.-	The sacrifice area and devil goat were unnecessary. However, if you enjoyed scarier elements of games like Farming Simulator and Chemical Spillage Simulator, this would be right up your alley9/10 would play again.

content:
1, 2014
												I've been a big fan of simulators for a long time now, and I look especially for depth, immersion and authenticity in all aspects of a good simulator game. ArmA has always been one for me that has brought me deep into the world of something I enjoy and given me a true to life, realistic perspective of what it would be like to live a day in those shoes. Goat Simulator however, takes it to a whole new level.I've watched goats for a long time now, studied them profusely and would in fact go as far as to call myself a Connoisseur of Goats, and what really impressed me about Goat Simulator is the sheer depth that it has achieved in making a goats daily life something that we can all enjoy. Whether you are simply exploring or as goats are prone to do, dragging a car up a water slide with your sticky tongue, you really feel like you're in the shoes of the Goat, or in its hooves should I say, and when you look at the physical properties the game accurately portrays of a goat in free fall or its impacting upon the ground, you really get a feel for just how passionately the R&D team on Goat Simulator studied the physical attributes of goats and their effects on the world for the games portrayle.I must say that as both an officionado of Goats and Simulators I couldn't ask for much more, however I am looking forward to a version that is compatible with Occulus Rift, so that I may see the world through a goats eyes. A tip to anybody who is seeking a more authentic, goatier expiriences, play the game with cups over your hands to simulate goat hooves, you will not be dissapointed, I promise you.10/10 - Redefines Perfection

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
1, 2014
												"Happiness isn't happiness without a violin playing goat."     - Julia RobertsHere we 'Goat' again with another simulator hitting the Steam front page. But wait, Goat Simulator is not like any other simulator that has preceded it. It's actually not that 'BAAAAD'. I mean, this is how goats are actually like in real life. Everyone knows that goats and trampolines together creates mass genocide, it's just common sense. I'll be honest, this isn't really the type of amazing piece of work you might expect from 'Van goat.' Nonetheless, Goat Simulator is one of those games where all its imperfections are what make it priceless. You might be stroking your 'goatee' in wonder, or perhaps really not at all, but rest assured that bugs and game-breaking hilarity are intentional mechanisms of the game's entertainment philosophy. It's hard to really write a review with so many goat puns 'butting' in, so I think you'll just have to take my word on the fact that this game is amazing.So don't be such a 'kid' and just get this game. You really won't regret the 'charge' on your card, despite any 'ramifications' created from the time you will waste playing this game. Or dont, whatever floats your 'Goat.'

content:
29, 2014
												It's not just a simulation, it's a journey. Through this groundbreaking simulation we are transformed; able to repercieve and refine our own lives through the experience of partaking of the essence of another lifeform. Some may see only a goat, but we become more. We surpass the mundane. We become the goat elivened with dreams, fantasies, and aspirations. Through the goat we become free to live out any and all freedoms this sumulated life grants us, free from disarming and constricting social bonds. As I partake of the simulation, I find myself overcome by the enlightenment granted by multiple and sometimes conflicting perceptions of the self. I am reminded that consciousness as we know it is infused throughout reality. I am redeemed. I am reborn. A solid 7/10.

When the heat death of the universe comes, the last sentient creatures in the galaxy will know that all of this, all of everything that has ever taken place, was worth it... because of Goat Simulator.

content:
, 2015
												Oh, my head hurts.  So much.  And I've only been playing for TEN MINUTES... Someone made a "funny" game, and the amazing bit is...it's actually FUNNY!  Quite an accomplishment indeed.  Truly some of the most idiotic feats of physics I have ever witnessed/executed, and it's STILL a more convincing "physics simulator" than Bad Rats!!     Oh, and you can consider the GTA games officially obsolete.  If you feel like a ten minute sociopathic "spree"/♥♥♥♥-around, Goat Simulator should be your game of choice.  Who needs to run down pedestrians in sports cars when you can head-butt cars and make them EXPLODE?!     Think I'll save this one for those times when I simply cannot endure day-to-day life/humanity any longer, and need myself a good laugh/mini-aneurism.  Truly one of the greatest "gimmick" games in the history of gaming. Verdict: 8.5/10 (c'mon...it doesn't deserve more than THAT.  It's still ♥♥♥♥in' stoopid).

content:
4, 2014
												Moment of real talk here. Is it ten US dollars good? In terms of content volume, stability, polish, structure, and consistency, on those very descriptors alone, no.However, this game basically tells us here in 2014 that, in the end, we just want to have fun. This game is fun. For how long it's fun is up to you. Even so, there is a definite primal reaction this game elicits that will tell all but the most jaded, or those who seriously crave structure, that yes, you are having fun. You are enjoying this nonsense. It wants nothing more than for you to just go forth and have fun discovering weird things and wreak havoc in ways where you may not always be in precise control, but you are probably enjoying it just for what silliness goes on by your hand (or tongue).It's a novelty, but it is also a powerful statement for the curiosity it is. There's a reason people wanted to play this, and it wasn't brand name, or celebrity voice actors, or any sort of technological prowess to show off the day's advanced hardware. It was because it looked fun, and I believe their expectations - and mine - have been met. If you just want to press WASD and be the rudest tourist visiting human society possible in the process, you will have fun.That should be the quality we take into account most of all with any of these games.
